intro: Limonium wrightii f. arbusculum, commonly known as the woolly sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its soft, fuzzy foliage and spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for coastal gardens. It is also valued for its ability to stabilize dunes and prevent erosion in coastal areas.
